question: What is the purpose of the <header> element in HTML?

choices.answer: To represent introductory content at the beginning of a document or section
To define a section of navigation links
To contain the main content of a document

question: What does the <nav> element represent in HTML?

choices.answer: An aside content related to the main content

question: Which HTML element contains the primary content of a document?
What is the purpose of the <section> element in HTML?
Which HTML element represents a self-contained piece of content?
What does the <aside> element represent in HTML?

choices.answer: The main content of a document
Content that is tangentially related to the main content

question: Which HTML element represents a footer for its nearest sectioning content?
What is the purpose of the <figure> and <figcaption> elements in HTML?

choices.answer: To represent a footer for its nearest sectioning content
To specify a longer quotation from another source
To represent self-contained content with an optional caption

question: Which HTML element is used to specify a longer quotation from another source?
What is the purpose of the <cite> element in HTML?

choices.answer: To represent the title of a work or the name of its author
To specify a longer quotation from another source
To indicate the title of a work or the name of its author
To represent self-contained content with an optional caption
